intro: Erysimum thyrsoideum, commonly known as the tall wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has pinnately divided, fuzzy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its showy flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
